statements.name: PROC FONTREG
statements.description: Enables you to update the SAS registry to include system fonts, which can then be used in SAS output.

arguments.name: MODE=
arguments.description: specifies how to handle new and existing fonts.

arguments.name: ADD
arguments.description: specifies to add fonts that do not already exist in the SAS registry. Do not modify existing fonts.

arguments.name: REPLACE
arguments.description: specifies to replace fonts that already exist in the SAS registry. Do not add new fonts.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: specifies to add new fonts that do not already exist in the SAS registry and replace fonts that already exist in the SAS registry.

arguments.name: MSGLEVEL=
arguments.description: specifies the level of detail to include in the SAS log.

arguments.name: VERBOSE
arguments.description: SAS log messages include which fonts were added, which fonts were not added, and which fonts were not understood. The log also contains a summary that indicates the number of fonts that were added, not added, and not understood.

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: SAS log messages include which fonts were added, and a summary that indicates the number of fonts that were added, not added, and not understood.

arguments.name: TERSE
arguments.description: SAS log messages include only the summary that indicates the number of fonts that were added, not added, and not understood.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No messages are written to the SAS log, except for errors (if encountered).

arguments.name: NOUPDATE
arguments.description: specifies that the procedure should run without updating the SAS registry.

arguments.name: USESASHELP
arguments.description: specifies that the SAS registry in the Sashelp library be updated.

statements.name: FONTFILE
statements.description: Specifies one or more font files to be processed.

arguments.name: file
arguments.description: is the complete pathname to a font file. If the file is recognized as a valid font file, then the file is processed. Each pathname must be enclosed in quotation marks. If you specify more than one pathname, then you must separate the pathnames with a space.

arguments.name: pfm-file
arguments.description: specifies a file specific to Windows that contains font metrics as well as the value of the Windows font name.

arguments.name: afm-file
arguments.description: specifies a file that contains font metrics.

statements.name: FONTPATH
statements.description: Specifies one or more directories to be searched for valid font files to process.

arguments.name: directory
arguments.description: specifies a directory to search. All files that are recognized as valid font files are processed. Each directory must be enclosed in quotation marks. If you specify more than one directory, then you must separate the directories with a space.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies a fileref to use with the FONTPATH statement.

statements.name: REMOVE
statements.description: Removes a font family, all fonts of a particular type (such as TrueType or Type1), or all fonts from the Core\Printing\Freetype\Fonts location of the SAS registry.

arguments.name: family-name
arguments.description: specifies the family name of the font that you want to remove from the Core\Printing\Freetype\Fonts key in the SAS registry. Enclose family-name in quotation marks if the value contains one or more spaces.

arguments.name: alias
arguments.description: specifies an alternative name, usually in a shortened form, for family-name. Enclose the alias name in quotation marks if the value contains one or more spaces.

arguments.name: family-type
arguments.description: specifies the name of a font type (such as TrueType or Type1) that SAS supports and that you want removed from the SAS registry.

arguments.name: _ALL_
arguments.description: specifies that all font families in the Core\Printing\Freetype\Fonts key in the SAS registry will be deleted.

statements.name: TRUETYPE
statements.description: Specifies one or more directories to be searched for TrueType font files.

arguments.name: directory
arguments.description: specifies a directory to search. Only files that are recognized as valid TrueType font files are processed. Each directory must be enclosed in quotation marks. If you specify more than one directory, then you must separate the directories with a space.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies a fileref to use with the TRUETYPE statement.

statements.name: TYPE1
statements.description: Specifies one or more directories to be searched for valid Type1 font files.

arguments.name: directory
arguments.description: specifies a directory to search. Only files that are recognized as valid Type1 font files are processed. Each directory must be enclosed in quotation marks. If you specify more than one directory, then you must separate the directories with a space.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies a fileref to use with the TYPE1 statement.

statements.name: OPENTYPE
statements.description: Specifies one or more directories to be searched for valid OpenType font files.

arguments.name: directory
arguments.description: specifies a directory to search. Only files that are recognized as valid OpenType font files are processed. Each directory must be enclosed in quotation marks. If you specify more than one directory, then you must separate the directories with a space.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies a fileref to use with the OPENTYPE statement.
